trans-unit.source: Get started with a Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: Get started with a Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: The <token>msgflow</token> design area is a visual designer where you create an end-to-end message flow, originating from a message source, processed by a bridge, and then sent to a destination.
trans-unit.target: The <token>msgflow</token> design area is a visual designer where you create an end-to-end message flow, originating from a message source, processed by a bridge, and then sent to a destination.

trans-unit.source: It is a canvas that you can drag components onto from the Toolbox, and then use them to configure the flow.
trans-unit.target: It is a canvas that you can drag components onto from the Toolbox, and then use them to configure the flow.

trans-unit.source: When you install <token>af_integration</token>, the installation adds the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> category under the <embeddedLabel>Templates</embeddedLabel> area in the <token>vsprvs</token> <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel> dialog.
trans-unit.target: When you install <token>af_integration</token>, the installation adds the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> category under the <embeddedLabel>Templates</embeddedLabel> area in the <token>vsprvs</token> <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel> dialog.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> category contains the following templates:
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel> category contains the following templates:

trans-unit.source: Project Template
trans-unit.target: Project Template

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Service
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Service

trans-unit.source: Use this template to create a new <token>msgflow_proj</token> for creating <token>af_integration</token> applications consisting of message sources, bridges, and message destinations.
trans-unit.target: Use this template to create a new <token>msgflow_proj</token> for creating <token>af_integration</token> applications consisting of message sources, bridges, and message destinations.

trans-unit.source: This project type is also used to create artifacts like schemas and transforms that are used by the <token>af_integration</token> application.
trans-unit.target: This project type is also used to create artifacts like schemas and transforms that are used by the <token>af_integration</token> application.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Service Artifacts
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Service Artifacts

trans-unit.source: Use this template to create a project that contains only the artifacts, namely <token>transform</token>s and Schemas.
trans-unit.target: Use this template to create a project that contains only the artifacts, namely <token>transform</token>s and Schemas.

trans-unit.source: You can use this project to create a <token>transform</token> or a schema that you want to upload to the <token>tpm_portal</token> for creating your agreements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this project to create a <token>transform</token> or a schema that you want to upload to the <token>tpm_portal</token> for creating your agreements.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: Create a BizTalk Services Project
trans-unit.target: Create a BizTalk Services Project

trans-unit.source: To create rich messaging endpoints, you need to start by creating a <token>msgflow_proj</token>:
trans-unit.target: To create rich messaging endpoints, you need to start by creating a <token>msgflow_proj</token>:

trans-unit.source: Open <token>vsprvs</token> as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open <token>vsprvs</token> as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>New</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Project</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>New</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Project</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel>, in the <embeddedLabel>Installed Templates</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel>, in the <embeddedLabel>Installed Templates</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: From the right-hand pane, select the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> template.
trans-unit.target: From the right-hand pane, select the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> template.

trans-unit.source: Enter the project name, location, and the name of the solution this project is a part of.
trans-unit.target: Enter the project name, location, and the name of the solution this project is a part of.

trans-unit.source: If you want this solution to have a separate folder in Windows Explorer, select <embeddedLabel>Create directory for solution</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If you want this solution to have a separate folder in Windows Explorer, select <embeddedLabel>Create directory for solution</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When you create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, it adds a MessageFlowitinerary.bcs file to the project.
trans-unit.target: When you create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, it adds a MessageFlowitinerary.bcs file to the project.

trans-unit.source: You should never delete the .bcs file from a <token>msgflow_proj</token> because you can’t add a standalone .bcs file to an existing project.
trans-unit.target: You should never delete the .bcs file from a <token>msgflow_proj</token> because you can’t add a standalone .bcs file to an existing project.

trans-unit.source: If you delete the .bcs file, create a new <token>msgflow_proj</token>, and copy over the artifacts (schemas and <token>transform</token>s) from the old project to the new one.
trans-unit.target: If you delete the .bcs file, create a new <token>msgflow_proj</token>, and copy over the artifacts (schemas and <token>transform</token>s) from the old project to the new one.

trans-unit.source: To add a <token>msgflow_proj</token> to an existing solution
trans-unit.target: To add a <token>msgflow_proj</token> to an existing solution

trans-unit.source: Open <token>vsprvs</token> as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open <token>vsprvs</token> as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Open an existing solution in <token>vsprvs</token>, right-click the solution name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open an existing solution in <token>vsprvs</token>, right-click the solution name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Project</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add New Project</embeddedLabel>, in the <embeddedLabel>Installed Templates</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add New Project</embeddedLabel>, in the <embeddedLabel>Installed Templates</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Services</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: From the right-hand pane, select the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> template.
trans-unit.target: From the right-hand pane, select the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> template.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name and location of the project.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name and location of the project.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Add Components to a BizTalk Services Project
trans-unit.target: Add Components to a BizTalk Services Project

trans-unit.source: <token>msgflow_proj</token> designer provides several components that you can place on the design area as visual representations of the message sources, message processing bridges, or message destinations.
trans-unit.target: <token>msgflow_proj</token> designer provides several components that you can place on the design area as visual representations of the message sources, message processing bridges, or message destinations.

trans-unit.source: These components can help you to efficiently design and implement a message flow.
trans-unit.target: These components can help you to efficiently design and implement a message flow.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>To add a component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token></legacyBold>, drag the component from the toolbox to the design area.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>To add a component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token></legacyBold>, drag the component from the toolbox to the design area.

trans-unit.source: To remove a component, right-click the component, and select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To remove a component, right-click the component, and select <embeddedLabel>Delete</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the available components, along with a brief description of the function of each shape:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the available components, along with a brief description of the function of each shape:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Purpose
trans-unit.target: Purpose

trans-unit.source: More Information
trans-unit.target: More Information

trans-unit.source: Connector
trans-unit.target: Connector

trans-unit.source: Connects two components in a <token>msgflow_proj</token> and routes the messages from one component to another.
trans-unit.target: Connects two components in a <token>msgflow_proj</token> and routes the messages from one component to another.

trans-unit.source: BRIDGES
trans-unit.target: BRIDGES

trans-unit.source: A one-way <token>xml_bridge</token> that processes a request message from a client that does not expect a response.
trans-unit.target: A one-way <token>xml_bridge</token> that processes a request message from a client that does not expect a response.

trans-unit.source: A two-way, request-reply <token>xml_bridge</token> that processes a request message from a client that expects a response.
trans-unit.target: A two-way, request-reply <token>xml_bridge</token> that processes a request message from a client that expects a response.

trans-unit.source: A pass-through bridge that passes the input message to the destination entity, as-is.
trans-unit.target: A pass-through bridge that passes the input message to the destination entity, as-is.

trans-unit.source: DESTINATIONS
trans-unit.target: DESTINATIONS

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Destination
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Destination

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to an Azure Blob.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to an Azure Blob.

trans-unit.source: FTP Destination
trans-unit.target: FTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a folder on an FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a folder on an FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: One-Way External Service Endpoint
trans-unit.target: One-Way External Service Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a one-way external service that takes a request but does not return anything in response.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a one-way external service that takes a request but does not return anything in response.

trans-unit.source: One-Way Relay Endpoint
trans-unit.target: One-Way Relay Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a one-way relay endpoint (on <token>sb2</token>) that takes a request but does not return anything in response.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a one-way relay endpoint (on <token>sb2</token>) that takes a request but does not return anything in response.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Queue Destination
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Queue Destination

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: SFTP Destination
trans-unit.target: SFTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a folder on an SFTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a folder on an SFTP Server.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Topic Destination
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Topic Destination

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a <token>sb2</token> topic.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a <token>sb2</token> topic.

trans-unit.source: Two-Way External Service Endpoint
trans-unit.target: Two-Way External Service Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a two-way external service that takes a request and gives back a response.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a two-way external service that takes a request and gives back a response.

trans-unit.source: Two-Way Relay Endpoint
trans-unit.target: Two-Way Relay Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Routes a message to a two-way relay endpoint (on <token>sb2</token>) that takes a request and gives back a response.
trans-unit.target: Routes a message to a two-way relay endpoint (on <token>sb2</token>) that takes a request and gives back a response.

trans-unit.source: SOURCES
trans-unit.target: SOURCES

trans-unit.source: FTP Source
trans-unit.target: FTP Source

trans-unit.source: Receives a message from a folder on an FTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Receives a message from a folder on an FTP Server.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Queue Source
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Queue Source

trans-unit.source: Receives a message from a <token>sb2</token> Queue.
trans-unit.target: Receives a message from a <token>sb2</token> Queue.

trans-unit.source: SFTP Source
trans-unit.target: SFTP Source

trans-unit.source: Receives a message from a folder on an SFTP Server.
trans-unit.target: Receives a message from a folder on an SFTP Server.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Subscription Source
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Subscription Source

trans-unit.source: Receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> Topic subscription.
trans-unit.target: Receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> Topic subscription.

trans-unit.source: Add Schemas and Transforms to your Project
trans-unit.target: Add Schemas and Transforms to your Project

trans-unit.source: A <legacyBold>schema</legacyBold> is the definition of the structure for a document or message.
trans-unit.target: A <legacyBold>schema</legacyBold> is the definition of the structure for a document or message.

trans-unit.source: It contains property information as it pertains to the records and fields within the structure.
trans-unit.target: It contains property information as it pertains to the records and fields within the structure.

trans-unit.source: If appropriate, a schema can contain multiple subschemas.
trans-unit.target: If appropriate, a schema can contain multiple subschemas.

trans-unit.source: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, you can add either an XML schema or a flat-file schema.
trans-unit.target: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, you can add either an XML schema or a flat-file schema.

trans-unit.source: A <legacyBold><token>transform</token></legacyBold> is an XML file that defines the correspondence between the records and fields in one schema and the records and fields in another schema.
trans-unit.target: A <legacyBold><token>transform</token></legacyBold> is an XML file that defines the correspondence between the records and fields in one schema and the records and fields in another schema.

trans-unit.source: You create <token>transform</token>s based on industry standards, non-industry standards (such as internal standards or legacy issues), or existing files.
trans-unit.target: You create <token>transform</token>s based on industry standards, non-industry standards (such as internal standards or legacy issues), or existing files.

trans-unit.source: You create <token>transform</token>s when you want to map data that you receive or send from one format to another.
trans-unit.target: You create <token>transform</token>s when you want to map data that you receive or send from one format to another.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>transform</token> project item to create maps that you include in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>transform</token> project item to create maps that you include in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: All <token>transform</token>s that you save have a <embeddedLabel>.trfm</embeddedLabel> file extension.
trans-unit.target: All <token>transform</token>s that you save have a <embeddedLabel>.trfm</embeddedLabel> file extension.

trans-unit.source: For more information about <token>transform</token>s, see <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring transforms</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about <token>transform</token>s, see <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring transforms</link>.

trans-unit.source: To add a new schema or transform to a BizTalk Service project
trans-unit.target: To add a new schema or transform to a BizTalk Service project

trans-unit.source: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, right-click the project name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Item</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, right-click the project name, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Item</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add New Item</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, or <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add New Item</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, or <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a flat-file schema from scratch or create a flat-file schema using a flat-file instance message.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a flat-file schema from scratch or create a flat-file schema using a flat-file instance message.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To use the wizard, see <link xlink:href="33b5de1f-1e4f-4f98-a39e-c2ebaeb23d1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard</link>.
trans-unit.target: To use the wizard, see <link xlink:href="33b5de1f-1e4f-4f98-a39e-c2ebaeb23d1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard</link>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
